revised_title: Effects of Alkalies, Acids, and Alkaline-Acid Salts on Growth and Cell Division in Echinus esculentus
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the effects of alkalies, acids, and alkaline-acid salts on the growth and cell division in fertilized eggs of Echinus esculentus. They found that variations in hydrogen and hydroxyl ion concentrations led to profound alterations in cell growth and division. The experiments also showed that increased alkalinity could induce pathological mitoses, similar to those seen in cancer cells. The study provides insights into the relationship between changes in ion concentrations and the development of malignant diseases.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
